info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:48AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast Georgia, Chatham. In southeast South Carolina, Beaufort, Colleton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous to widespread showers and thunderstorms with torrential rains extending from near Tybee Island to Hilton Head and Hunting Island, moving northeast at 10 to 15 mph. A quick to 1 to 3 inches of rain can be expected in this area through 345 AM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. A few spots have already reported rain amounts over 2.5 inches this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilton Head Island, Bluffton, Beaufort, Port Royal, Tybee Island, Edisto Beach, Fort Pulaski National Monument, Wilmington Island, Downtown Savannah, Thunderbolt, Hilton Head Airport, Folly Field, Parris Island, Forest Beach, Shell Point, Burton, Ladys Island, Fripp Island, Whitemarsh Island and Wassaw Island.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
